alert.note: Alert for Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Washington County through 245 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greenwich, or 8 miles southwest of Salem, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Greenwich, Shushan, Clarks Mills, Battenville, Center Falls, East Greenwich, Rexleigh, Middle Falls, Thomson, Eagleville, Anaquassacook, North Cambridge, Coila, Greenwich Junction, South Argyle, North Greenwich, Fitch Point, Bald Mountain and Spraguetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
